metadata.title: CVE-2024-45014 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:s390/boot: Avoid possible physmem_info segment corruptionWhen physical memory for the kernel image is allocated it does notconsider extra memory required for offsetting the image start tomatch it with the lower 20 bits of KASLR virtual base address. Thatmight lead to kernel access beyond its memory range.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-45014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
